nodes.description: Expert-level skills

nodes.label: Intro to OOP
nodes.description: Understand the fundamental concepts and principles of Object-Oriented Programming.

nodes.label: Classes and Objects
nodes.description: Learn how to define classes, create objects, and understand their relationship.

nodes.label: Constructors
nodes.description: Understand how to initialize objects using constructors and constructor overloading.

nodes.label: Access Modifiers
nodes.description: Learn to control the visibility and accessibility of classes, fields, and methods.

nodes.label: Encapsulation
nodes.description: Grasp the concept of data hiding and bundling data with methods that operate on the data.

nodes.label: Inheritance
nodes.description: Explore how to create new classes based on existing ones, promoting code reusability.

nodes.label: Polymorphism
nodes.description: Understand how objects can take on many forms, enabling flexible and extensible code.

nodes.label: Intro to Abstraction
nodes.description: Learn to hide complex implementation details and show only essential features.

nodes.label: Abstract Classes
nodes.description: Master creating abstract classes and methods to define common interfaces for subclasses.

nodes.label: Interfaces
nodes.description: Understand how interfaces define contracts for classes to implement, supporting multiple inheritance of type.

nodes.label: Limits and Continuity
nodes.description: Understand the concept of a limit and how it relates to function continuity.

nodes.label: Definition of the Derivative
nodes.description: Learn the formal definition of the derivative as a limit and its geometric interpretation.

nodes.label: Differentiation Rules
nodes.description: Master fundamental rules for differentiation including power, product, and quotient rules.

nodes.label: Chain Rule
nodes.description: Apply the chain rule to differentiate composite functions efficiently.

nodes.label: Implicit Differentiation
nodes.description: Differentiate equations that are not explicitly solved for one variable in terms of another.

nodes.label: Related Rates
nodes.description: Solve problems involving rates of change of two or more related variables.

nodes.label: Optimization
nodes.description: Use derivatives to find maximum or minimum values of functions in real-world scenarios.

nodes.label: Antiderivatives and Indefinite Integrals
nodes.description: Understand antiderivatives as the inverse of derivatives and calculate indefinite integrals.

nodes.label: Definite Integrals and Riemann Sums
nodes.description: Explore definite integrals as accumulated change and their approximation using Riemann sums.

nodes.label: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
nodes.description: Grasp the pivotal theorem linking differentiation and integration.

nodes.label: Integration Techniques
nodes.description: Learn various methods for solving complex integrals, including u-substitution and integration by parts.

nodes.label: Applications of Integration
nodes.description: Apply definite integrals to calculate areas, volumes, and other physical quantities.

nodes.label: Sequences and Series
nodes.description: Study the behavior and convergence of infinite sequences and series.

nodes.label: Introduction to Multivariable Calculus
nodes.description: Begin exploring functions of multiple variables, partial derivatives, and multiple integrals.
